Activity: Log in, check emails, and address any urgent requests. Reflect on feedback from yesterday's meeting and prepare to finalize the design.
Final review of the influenza database schema design. Ensure all feedback has been addressed and the design is complete and accurate.
Conduct a final check of data types for each column, ensuring they are appropriate and consistent across all tables.
Create a final version of the database schema design document, including all table definitions, data type specifications, and relationship diagrams.
Send the final database schema design document to @itpm-1, @da-1, @da-2, @clinlead-1, @ehrdev-1, @ehrdev-2, @his-1, @his-2 for approval.
Begin planning the next phase of the project, which may involve creating the database in a test environment and populating it with sample data.
Review the overall project timeline and identify any potential roadblocks or challenges that may need to be addressed.
Document any lessons learned during the database schema design process and share them with the team. Begin end-of-week reports.
Complete the end-of-week reports and get ready for the weekend.
